what: A companion package for the book Introduction to Discrete Choice Analysis with `R`
title: A companion package for the book Introduction to Discrete Choice Analysis with `R`
text: Package {discrtr} companion book Introduction Discrete Choice Analysis R. includes data sets supporting materials used book.

title: A companion package for the book Introduction to Discrete Choice Analysis with `R`
text: can install development version discrtr GitHub :

title: A companion package for the book Introduction to Discrete Choice Analysis with `R`
text: One data set included package relates commuting university setting. Analysis data reported Whalen, P’{}ez, Carrasco (2012). wide version data table can loaded follows: quick summary travel time variables table: four modes transportation data set, modes available every respondent, hence NA’s. missing value time variables indicates mode part choice set corresponding traveller.
code: library(discrtr) data("mc_commute_wide") library(dplyr) mc_commute_wide %>%    dplyr::select(starts_with("time.")) %>%   summary() #>    time.Cycle        time.Walk        time.HSR         time.Car     #>  Min.   : 0.3106   Min.   : 1.00   Min.   :  1.00   Min.   : 1.00   #>  1st Qu.: 2.9141   1st Qu.:10.00   1st Qu.:  4.00   1st Qu.: 5.00   #>  Median : 4.3711   Median :15.00   Median :  8.00   Median :10.00   #>  Mean   : 5.4278   Mean   :16.09   Mean   : 16.82   Mean   :12.86   #>  3rd Qu.: 6.2112   3rd Qu.:20.00   3rd Qu.: 20.00   3rd Qu.:20.00   #>  Max.   :45.0000   Max.   :62.11   Max.   :120.00   Max.   :72.00   #>  NA's   :997       NA's   :513     NA's   :54       NA's   :622

title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
text: delimited text file containing information commuting McMaster University. Data collected means travel survey fall 2010. Respondents asked mode travel McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada. also asked modes available . characteristics trips self-reported imputed. dataset also contains relevant attributes respondents. format table long, row representing choice situation.

title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
text: comma separated text file : RespondentID Unique identifier respondents choice numeric variable indicating modes transportation: (1) Cycle, (2) Walk, (3) HSR (local transit), (4) Car avcycle Indicator variable availability cycling: (1) Yes, (0) avwalk Indicator variable availability walking: (1) Yes, (0) avhsr Indicator variable availability HSR: (1) Yes, (0) avcar Indicator variable availability car: (1) Yes, (0) timecycle Travel time cycling minutes (mode available coded 100000) timewalk Travel time walking minutes (mode available coded 100000) accesshsr Access time HSR minutes waitingtimehsr Waiting time travelling HSR minutes transfer Number transit transfers timecar Travel time car minutes (mode available coded 100000) parking Indicator variable holding university parking permit: (1) Yes, (0) vehind Indicator variable individual access private car (.e., car shared household members): (1) Yes, (0) owncycle Indicator variable owning bicycle: (1) Yes, (0) gender Indicator variable gender: (1) Woman, (0) Man age Age years solo Indicator variable living solo accommodations: (1) Yes, (0) shared Indicator variable student living rental property students, .e., shared accommodations: (1) Yes, (0) family Indicator variable living family home: (1) Yes, (0) child Indicator variable presence dependent minors household: (1) Yes, (0) primary_caregiver Indicator variable primary caregiver dependent minors household: (1) Yes, (0) , (100000) dependent minors household LAT Latitude place residence, geocoded nearest major intersection centroid 6-digit postal area LONG Longitude place residence, geocoded nearest major intersection centroid 6-digit postal area DAUID Unique ID dissemination area place residence according 2006 census Canada mhi Median household income dissemination area place residence according 2006 census Canada dwell_den Dwelling density dissemination area place residence $1/km^2$ lum Entropy land use mix st_den Street density dissemination area place residence $km/km^2$ inter_den Intersection density dissemination area place residence $1/km^2$ SF_P_ratio Ratio surface plots built area side_density Sidewalk density dissemination area place residence $km/km^2$ Shelters_SD Response statement "Shelters public transportation facilities commonly use good quality": 1 Strongly Disagree, 0 otherwise Shelters_D Response statement "Shelters public transportation facilities commonly use good quality": 1 Disagree, 0 otherwise Shelters_A Response statement "Shelters public transportation facilities commonly use good quality": 1 Agree, 0 otherwise Shelters_SA Response statement "Shelters public transportation facilities commonly use good quality": 1 Strongly Agree, 0 otherwise

title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
text: Whalen, K. E., P\'aez, ., & Carrasco, J. . (2013). Mode choice university students commuting school role active travel. Journal Transport Geography, 31, 132-142. (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jtrangeo.2013.06.008)

title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
code: library(readr)  mc_commute <- read_csv(system.file("extdata", "mc_commute.csv", package = "discrtr")) #> Rows: 1376 Columns: 39 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> dbl (39): RespondentID, choice, avcycle, avwalk, avhsr, avcar, timecycle, ti... #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: McMaster Commuting Dataset (wide format). — mc_commute_wide
